search_results.snippet:
A chess opening is the group of initial moves of a chess game. Recognized 
sequences of initial moves are referred to as openings by White, or defenses by 
Black, but opening is also used as the general term. There are many dozens of 
different openings, and hundreds of named ... These vary widely in character 
from quiet positional play to wild tactical play.

question: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew shows off his moves on the monitor.) In this classic chess opening, after white plays e4, to fight for the center, black plays c5 in this 8-letter defense named for a Mediterranean island
